article:
The Changing Face of Halloween
October 31st is Halloween when children in the UK dress up as ghosts and go "trick or treat". They   _  their neighbors and show off their costumes and   in return  are given some gifts.
    If a child   knocks on  your door on Halloween, you should be ready with treats (usually sweets or chocolate) for them. If you don't   hand over  a treat, they might play a   _  on you, like saying "Boo!" to try to scare you or play some other kinds of    _   joke.
     But police departments around the country say there's been a   _   rise in anti-social behavior linked to the   _  door-to-door Halloween calls. A policeman said, "On a(n)   _   day, we receive 776 calls by means of the 999 system, but on the 31st of October last year, this was   up to  1,388."
